name: Introductory Mechanics
description: This course introduces students to classical mechanics. Students will learn about kinematics, dynamics, and conservation laws.

name: Introductory Electromagnetism
description: This course introduces students to classical electromagnetism. Students will learn about electric and magnetic fields, electromagnetic waves, and Maxwell's equations.

name: Thermal Physics
description: This course introduces students to thermal physics. Students will learn about the laws of thermodynamics, statistical mechanics, and thermodynamic potentials.

name: Introduction to Quantum Mechanics
description: This course introduces students to quantum mechanics. Students will learn about wave-particle duality, quantum states, and operators.

name: Introduction to Optics
description: This course introduces students to optics. Students will learn about ray optics, wave optics, and the interaction of light with matter.

name: Atomic Physics
description: This course introduces students to atomic physics. Students will learn about atomic structure, atomic spectra, and quantum mechanics in atoms.

name: Molecular Physics
description: This course introduces students to molecular physics. Students will learn about molecular structure, molecular spectra, and quantum mechanics in molecules.

name: Optical Physics
description: This course introduces students to optical physics. Students will learn about basic principles of laser optics, waveguides, fiber optics, and nonlinear optics.
